info.name: Cranial nerves of Pons
info.description: The cranial nerves associated with the pons are the trigeminal (V), abducens (VI), facial (VII) and vestibulocochlear (VIII).  Note that the vestibular and cochlear nuclei are actually located in both the pons and medulla beneath the vestibular area --as seen in the floor of the fourth ventricle.  The vestibular and cochlear nerves enter the brainstem at the junction of the pons with the medulla in the cerebellopontine angle.
